# OpenAI   

## 1. About section: company overview   
-Founded date, location, size    
-Mission and vision    
-Key executives & founders      
OpenAI was founded in December 2015 in San Francisco, California, and has grown to employ over 500 people. The company's mission is to ensure that artificial general intelligence (AGI) benefits all of humanity. OpenAI's vision is to be at the forefront of AGI development while prioritizing safety and ethical considerations. Key executives include Sam Altman (CEO), Greg Brockman (President), and Ilya Sutskever (Chief Scientist). [NEWS: OpenAI has raised $6.6 billion in a new funding round, boosting its valuation to $157 billion and solidifying its status as one of the world's most valuable private companies, with major investments from Thrive Capital, Microsoft, and Nvidia, among others].      

# 2. Products, tech stacks & industries     
-Main AI products/offering     
-Target markets and industries   
-Core AI technologies used  
-Proprietary algorithms or models  
-Research focus areas   
-Notable publications or patents   
OpenAI has emerged as a leading AI research company, known for its popular products such as ChatGPT, GPT language models, DALL-E for image generation, Whisper for speech recognition, and Codex for code generation. Its offerings are used across industries like technology, healthcare, finance, education, media, and customer service, serving both large enterprises and individual developers. OpenAI specializes in generative AI and large language models, with key technologies like transformer neural networks, reinforcement learning, and multimodal AI. The company also pioneers proprietary developments like InstructGPT, Constitutional AI, and CLIP, and conducts research in AI safety, computer vision, robotics, and natural language processing. Their advanced models and research have positioned OpenAI at the forefront of artificial intelligence innovation.   

# 3. Market Position & financials     
-Market share   
-Competitive advantages   
-Revenue and growth rates  
-Funding rounds (if applicable)  
-Key investors  
-Key partnerships and collaborations  
OpenAI has experienced remarkable financial growth, reporting $300 million in revenue in early 2024, a 1,700% increase from the previous year, with projected revenue of $11.6 billion for the coming year. However, it still operates at a loss, with expected losses of $5 billion in 2024 due to high AI infrastructure costs. Recently, the company raised $6.6 billion in one of the largest private investments in U.S. history, bringing its post-money valuation to $157 billion. Key investors include Thrive Capital, Microsoft, Nvidia, SoftBank, and several others, although Apple was notably absent. This funding is aimed at enhancing AI research, expanding computational capabilities, and developing new tools, with OpenAI currently serving 250 million active ChatGPT users, including 11 million ChatGPT Plus subscribers and 1 million business users.
